channel.title: Spring on Ksbigbass
channel.description: Recent content in Spring on Ksbigbass

item.title: Chatterbaits for Spawn
item.description:
Chatterbaits for Spawn time largemouth bass fishing. Finding active fish willing to bite a moving bait is very productive in the spring. Fish are shallow and can be very aggressive.

Take advantage of that.

Largemouth bass want to spawn in water that is shallow 3-5 ft is common but with stable water conditions, they may have as little as 6 inches over their heads.

Often they want a piece of cover to hide in or around to go with it. A laydown or logs or virtually any stick or piece of cover in the backs of creeks and coves has the potential to hold a giant bass.

item.title: Not Missing a Key Element
item.description:
Not Missing a Key Element: I am on my way to Table Rock Lake for a Much needed week of fishing.    As I do my homework checking water levels, temps, and local guides fishing reports, I can’t quit thinking about throwing a gill painted topwater for some monster bass.

Not Missing a Key Element

So I ask _…_How often are you throwing baits that imitate sunfish?

There is a reason fish biologists use sunfish as the primary food source for bass when stocking a pond. It’s as if bass live to eat them. Whether it’s bluegill, green ear or red ear sunfish, rock bass or pumpkinseed, all of these fish play a critical role in the diet of most bass throughout the United States.

item.title: What about the Stalkers KVD?
item.description:
What about the Stalkers KVD?

 Great Video where KVD talks about using a topwater popper!

May is a great time to start throwing topwater baits, start in 60 degree surface water temp and I always start with a Pop-r.

https://youtu.be/i-lA3KkqES0

This video is such a great piece of info from one of the best.

But one big thing I think KVD fails to mention in this video is to watch for stalkers!

item.title: The Meat.
item.description:
The Meat.

Today : May 7, 2011 2:53 am

I fished for 2 hrs today in the afternoon.  The weather was the normal 25-40 mph South winds and a warm 76 degrees.
